trans-unit.source: Drop-down lists
trans-unit.target: Drop-down lists

trans-unit.source: Drop-down lists, also known as combo boxes, start in a compact state and expand to show a list of selectable items.
trans-unit.target: Drop-down lists, also known as combo boxes, start in a compact state and expand to show a list of selectable items.

trans-unit.source: A drop-down list supports either single selection or multiple selection.
trans-unit.target: A drop-down list supports either single selection or multiple selection.

trans-unit.source: The selected item is always visible, and non-visible items can be brought into view when the user taps the selected item.
trans-unit.target: The selected item is always visible, and non-visible items can be brought into view when the user taps the selected item.

trans-unit.source: Use a drop-down list to let users select a single value from a set of items that can be adequately represented with single lines of text.
trans-unit.target: Use a drop-down list to let users select a single value from a set of items that can be adequately represented with single lines of text.

trans-unit.source: Use a list or grid view instead of a drop-down to display items that contain multiple lines of text or images.
trans-unit.target: Use a list or grid view instead of a drop-down to display items that contain multiple lines of text or images.

trans-unit.source: When there are fewer than five items, consider using [radio buttons](radio-button.md) (if only one item can be selected) or [check boxes](checkbox.md) (if multiple items can be selected).
trans-unit.target: When there are fewer than five items, consider using [radio buttons](radio-button.md) (if only one item can be selected) or [check boxes](checkbox.md) (if multiple items can be selected).

trans-unit.source: Use a drop-down list when the selection items are of secondary importance in the flow of your app.
trans-unit.target: Use a drop-down list when the selection items are of secondary importance in the flow of your app.

trans-unit.source: If the default option is recommended for most users in most situations, showing all the items by using a list box might draw more attention to the options than necessary.
trans-unit.target: If the default option is recommended for most users in most situations, showing all the items by using a list box might draw more attention to the options than necessary.

trans-unit.source: You can save space and minimize distraction by using a drop-down list.

trans-unit.source: List boxes
trans-unit.target: List boxes

trans-unit.source: A list box allows the user to choose either a single item or multiple items from a collection.
trans-unit.target: A list box allows the user to choose either a single item or multiple items from a collection.

trans-unit.source: List boxes are similar to drop-down lists, except that list boxes are always open—there is no compact (non-expanded) state for a list box.
trans-unit.target: List boxes are similar to drop-down lists, except that list boxes are always open—there is no compact (non-expanded) state for a list box.

trans-unit.source: Items in the list can be scrolled if there isn't space to show everything.
trans-unit.target: Items in the list can be scrolled if there isn't space to show everything.

trans-unit.source: Is this the right control?
trans-unit.target: Is this the right control?

trans-unit.source: A list box can be useful when items in the list are important enough to prominently display, and when there's enough screen real estate, to show the full list.
trans-unit.target: A list box can be useful when items in the list are important enough to prominently display, and when there's enough screen real estate, to show the full list.

trans-unit.source: A list box should draw the user's attention to the full set of alternatives in an important choice.
trans-unit.target: A list box should draw the user's attention to the full set of alternatives in an important choice.

trans-unit.source: By contrast, a drop-down list initially draws the user's attention to the selected item.
trans-unit.target: By contrast, a drop-down list initially draws the user's attention to the selected item.

trans-unit.source: Avoid using a list box if:
trans-unit.target: Avoid using a list box if:

trans-unit.source: There is a very small number of items for the list.
trans-unit.target: There is a very small number of items for the list.

trans-unit.source: A single-select list box that always has the same 2 options might be better presented as [radio buttons](radio-button.md).
trans-unit.target: A single-select list box that always has the same 2 options might be better presented as [radio buttons](radio-button.md).

trans-unit.source: Also consider using radio buttons when there are 3 or 4 static items in the list.
trans-unit.target: Also consider using radio buttons when there are 3 or 4 static items in the list.

trans-unit.source: The list box is single-select and it always has the same 2 options where one can be implied as not the other, such as "on" and "off."
trans-unit.target: The list box is single-select and it always has the same 2 options where one can be implied as not the other, such as "on" and "off."

trans-unit.source: Use a single check box or a toggle switch.
trans-unit.target: Use a single check box or a toggle switch.

trans-unit.source: There is a very large number of items.
trans-unit.target: There is a very large number of items.

trans-unit.source: A better choice for long lists are grid view and list view.
trans-unit.target: A better choice for long lists are grid view and list view.

trans-unit.source: For very long lists of grouped data, semantic zoom is preferred.
trans-unit.target: For very long lists of grouped data, semantic zoom is preferred.

trans-unit.source: The items are contiguous numerical values.
trans-unit.target: The items are contiguous numerical values.

trans-unit.source: If that's the case, consider using a [slider](slider.md).
trans-unit.target: If that's the case, consider using a [slider](slider.md).

trans-unit.source: The selection items are of secondary importance in the flow of your app or the default option is recommended for most users in most situations.
trans-unit.target: The selection items are of secondary importance in the flow of your app or the default option is recommended for most users in most situations.

trans-unit.source: Use a drop-down list instead.
trans-unit.target: Use a drop-down list instead.

trans-unit.source: Selection mode
trans-unit.target: Selection mode

trans-unit.source: Selection mode lets users select and take action on a single item or on multiple items.
trans-unit.target: Selection mode lets users select and take action on a single item or on multiple items.

trans-unit.source: It can be invoked through a context menu, by using CTRL+click or SHIFT+click on an item, or by rolling-over a target on an item in a gallery view.
trans-unit.target: It can be invoked through a context menu, by using CTRL+click or SHIFT+click on an item, or by rolling-over a target on an item in a gallery view.

trans-unit.source: When selection mode is active, check boxes appear next to each list item, and actions can appear at the top or the bottom of the screen.
trans-unit.target: When selection mode is active, check boxes appear next to each list item, and actions can appear at the top or the bottom of the screen.

trans-unit.source: There are three selection modes:
trans-unit.target: There are three selection modes:

trans-unit.source: Single: The user can select only one item at a time.
trans-unit.target: Single: The user can select only one item at a time.

trans-unit.source: Multiple: The user can select multiple items without using a modifier.
trans-unit.target: Multiple: The user can select multiple items without using a modifier.

trans-unit.source: Extended: The user can select multiple items with a modifier, such as holding down the SHIFT key.
trans-unit.target: Extended: The user can select multiple items with a modifier, such as holding down the SHIFT key.

trans-unit.source: Tapping anywhere on an item selects it.
trans-unit.target: Tapping anywhere on an item selects it.

trans-unit.source: Tapping on the command bar action affects all selected items.
trans-unit.target: Tapping on the command bar action affects all selected items.

trans-unit.source: If no item is selected, command bar actions should be inactive, except for "Select All".
trans-unit.target: If no item is selected, command bar actions should be inactive, except for "Select All".

trans-unit.source: Selection mode doesn't have a light dismiss model; tapping outside of the frame in which selection mode is active won't cancel the mode.
trans-unit.target: Selection mode doesn't have a light dismiss model; tapping outside of the frame in which selection mode is active won't cancel the mode.

trans-unit.source: This is to prevent accidental deactivation of the mode.
trans-unit.target: This is to prevent accidental deactivation of the mode.

trans-unit.source: Clicking the back button dismisses the multi-select mode.
trans-unit.target: Clicking the back button dismisses the multi-select mode.

trans-unit.source: Show a visual confirmation when an action is selected.
trans-unit.target: Show a visual confirmation when an action is selected.

trans-unit.source: Consider displaying a confirmation dialog for certain actions, especially destructive actions such as delete.
trans-unit.target: Consider displaying a confirmation dialog for certain actions, especially destructive actions such as delete.

trans-unit.source: Selection mode is confined to the page in which it is active, and can't affect any items outside of that page.
trans-unit.target: Selection mode is confined to the page in which it is active, and can't affect any items outside of that page.

trans-unit.source: The entry point to selection mode should be juxtaposed against the content it affects.
trans-unit.target: The entry point to selection mode should be juxtaposed against the content it affects.
